edu.up.cs301.game
Class GameMainActivity

java.lang.Object
  Activity
      edu.up.cs301.game.GameMainActivity
Direct Known Subclasses:
TTTMainActivity
public abstract class GameMainActivity
extends Activity

class GameMainActivity is the main activity for the game framework. To create a new game, create a sub-class of this class that implements its abstract methods below.

Author:
Andrew M. Nuxoll, Steven R. Vegdahl

Constructor Detail

GameMainActivity

public GameMainActivity()
Method Detail

createDefaultConfig

public abstract GameConfig createDefaultConfig()
Creates a default, game-specific configuration for the current game. IMPORTANT: The default configuration must be a legal configuration!

Returns:
an instance of the GameConfig class that defines a default configuration for this game. (The default may be subsequently modified by the user if this is allowed.)

createLocalGame

public abstract LocalGame createLocalGame()
createLocalGame Creates a new game that runs on the server tablet. For example, if you were creating tic-tac-toe, you would implement this method to return an instance of your TTTLocalGame class which, in turn, would be a subclass of LocalGame.

Returns:
a new, game-specific instance of a sub-class of the LocalGame class.

onCreate

public final void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
onCreate "main" for the game framework

onConfigurationChanged

public void onConfigurationChanged(Configuration newConfig)
Callback-method, called when the configuration changes--typically when the tablet is rotated.

initializes the pages in the tabbed dialog

public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)

onClick

public void onClick(View button)
this method is called whenever the user clicks on a button.

NOTE: With the current layout it could either be a Button or ImageButton.

scrapeData

public GameConfig scrapeData()
scrapeData retrieves all the data from the GUI and creates a new GameConfig object with it

onKeyDown

public boolean onKeyDown(int keyCode,
                         KeyEvent event)
Call-back method when a soft key-event happens. Intercepts the "back" button so that the activity is not killed with out user confirmation (unless the game is already over).

setGameOver

public void setGameOver(boolean b)
marks the game as being over

Parameters:
b - tells whether the game is over

doFinish

public void doFinish(View v)
finishes the activity

Parameters:
v - the object that cause the callback
